Reviews.Title: “Improvements are coming”
Reviews.Author: Fredinaltamonte
Reviews.Content: For all of you Islander bashers out there, I went by it yesterday and it looks like it is being completely rebuilt. It has been completely stripped to the inner structure. I have no idea how long it will take to get done and what all is being done, but my guess is that, among other things, it will lose its place as one of the cheapest hotels on the beach. If anyone out there has additional information, please share. I hope they don't do away with the open air hallways. That is always my favorite part of the "Old Florida" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place I ALWAYS stay when I visit”
Reviews.Author: Ivory7881
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed to read all the bad reviews, so I'm going to write a positive one. I love this hotel. No, it's not the Ritz, but the prices are also not the Ritz. If you are looking for a hotel with spa and little mints on your pillow, no this may not be the place for you. When I call, the staff is ALWAYS friendly and they already have me in their system so they always greet me with a smile. I get my room quickly - always oceanfront - and the room is always reasonably clean - reasonable as in "lived in" but livable. The food is much like a lot of other hotels but, hey, it's free so why not? Never seen a bedbug there but if I did, I am certain they would change me to another room. Shower always worked, door was always fine, no problems. Loved the pool and hot tub (although the hot tub could use some updating). LOVED the Tiki bar. And the closeness of the beach just beyond the pool is incredible. I never stay in the hotel long enough to whine and complain about everything I'm not getting. That's not what I am there for. The hotel is comfortable and the atmosphere is great - not snobbish like a lot of the others. I like it. And I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: newbie2008Buford_Ga
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews, but couldn't pass up the 50 % off price. We had a very clean room, with an ocean view, just as promised. There were no bed bugs, and the kitchen and bathroom were clean as well. The lock on our door was only secured by one screw, but we had no security issues. The breakfast wasn't great, but it was free. Over all, nice hotel for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: nelly c
Reviews.Content: We ere there from the 4 to the 7th of August and do not know where the awful bad reviews some people are posting come from. This is not the Hilton, but it is a nice, quiet, clean, affordable little hotel that has nothing to envy from a lot of other hotels in the area. This is an old structure well kept, clean, the pool is good, with complimentary breakfast (that is not bad). The only thing I would recommend is that they update the game room for bigger kids and paint or cover the back area of the pool to make it more appealing to the eye, but besides that I have no concerns. It is safe, the staff is friendly and helpfull. We had towels available all the time, shampoo, soap and evry other little gadget you have in fancy hotels. I definitely recomend it for family stays. We will go back

Reviews.Title: “It was a horrible hotel but staff were very helpful”
Reviews.Author: me123Winnipeg
Reviews.Content: Mildew in the whole place Mold in rooms Needs a whole re-do

Reviews.Title: “1 word, DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: supamom
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER stay in this hotel again!!!!!! The only reason I stayed is because we had our dog and it was the only place available that accepted pets. The young girl at the front was very nice and helpful, but the room was horrible. The floor was DISGUSTING, I almost didn't want my dog to walk on it that's how nasty it was. The bathroom was TINY, you had to almost take your hand off to get the front door to close. The kitchen area was the best kept area in the entire room. I will NEVER return there, unless they renovate. The property is VERY old, out dated, stinky, and etc etc..... My stomach is turning as I write and remember what I experienced. My kids enjoyed themselves and that's what counts. If you're just passing through or don't care about where you lay your head, this is an ok place. Other than that the extra fee somewhere else is WELL worth it. Oh and wi fi is NOT free in the comfort of your room. There is a fee to use it, but you can go in the lobby and use it for free. I was on vacation I didn't want to leave my dirty private room to be interrupted by guest just to surf the internet. DON'T trust the photos, the pool is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: tetterman
Reviews.Content: We were there first week of June 2011.Thought the price was good until we checked in.Alot of hidden charges,Had to pay to have phone turned on.Had to pay to park our car or anyone else that came to see us.Had to pay to use the wi-fi.The rooms were in very bad shape very old and the balcony stay off very bad condition.No water pressure in the bathroom and the worst thing was the freinds that came out at night to play.Yes roaches all in the kitchen.Wish I read this first.Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bargain and not nearly as bad as most of reviews.”
Reviews.Author: otwowntiger
Reviews.Content: Sure its not luxury by any means but my wife and 2 young sons stayed here this past weekend and had a great time. Our room was on the 10th floor had an awesome view and was very clean. There was no smell, no bugs, the sheets were clean, the beds reasonably comfortable and the walls were not peeling. The bathroom was very clean. The staff was courteous but we only had limited interaction since we had no problems. The complimentary continental breakfast left a little to be desired but it was free so I'm not complaining. The pool was also very nice and clean. Overall it could use some updating and clearly the customers are not high class, but what more would expect for $64 during (or near peak) season with an OCEAN FRONT view?

Reviews.Title: “NASTY! Don't Believe the photos”
Reviews.Author: Orlandotraveler08
Reviews.Content: OMG! This place was so nasty! The room we got had black mold around the windows big chunks of cement was missing on the balcony and the AC was rusted and smelled very nasty we went to CVS and got some Lysol to spray the room. the carpet was stained and very gross! We tried to check out but they would not give us our money back or give us a diffrent room cause they said the room was already assigned to us and they couldn't change it because we booked through Hotels.com which I will NEVER book with again. If your going to Daytona your best bet would be just wait till you get there and get your room cause that way you can ask to see the room before you check in and if it's nasty like this this place was at least you can just walk out and go to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: ceacat
Reviews.Content: stayed memorial weekend 2011- The hotel was okay-not a 5 star but for the money , I thought it was okay. The check in staff was questionable... ONE was friendly the rest were rude, sarcastic & not helpful at all. Definately needs work on the staffing. The grounds people & maintance workers & maid staff very nice & helpful-- so ignor the front staff & you'll have a great stay. the Rooms were ok but this is an older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hate. Although you will definately have the urge, don't trash the place out of revenge.”
Reviews.Author: Alfairbrother
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hell hole. I read the reviews, but did not believe them. Housekeeping never came. We had a broken toilet that they never came to fix, we had to use the one in the lobby. The rooms were dirty. Found long black hairs on the bathroom towels, and in the bedding. Old and smelly, just like the rude staff

Reviews.Title: “why all the negs on this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: ellabella032
Reviews.Content: Myself and 10 family members stayed here for one night,we found the rooms clean and the elevators clean,myself had room 516 which was fully equiped with fridge,stove,micro,toater.coffee maker,pots n pans,side of hotel location,with view of beach and road,staff was very nice,easy to check in and out,no problems,didnt see any roaches or other bugs,clean towels and soaps shampoos etc,the room either side of myself had no cooker etc,but were clean,ask for cooker and stuff before you book your room if its what you want,maid was very pleasant,pool and juccuzi was clean,game room was gr8 for kids,ok the hall carpets were stained but so what! maybe they are gonna get some new ones,,but we all had a great time and after i read all the neg reviews i believe they are from stuck up people who expect 5 * from a 2 * hotel.and hey this is florida..we are used to roaches,its a hot climate,if roaches freak you out i suggest u stay up north :P i would definately stay in this hotel again,AT night it was very peacfull n quiet,you car parking will cost you $5,,NO PROBLEM,

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck! Well worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeawisconsin
Reviews.Content: We could not wait til we got home to write our review. We are delightfully surprised to find our old spot is just as good if not better than before. We had been coming to this hotel which was previously called The Seagarden Inn. This hotel was closed down for a while so we had to go elsewhere. We heard they reopened and read so many negative reviews and it was making us leery of going back. Our family party of ten decided to give it another try and we are so glad that we came back. If you need the Tashmahal go down the road, but if you are looking for a great value and a room with a kitchen on the ocean, with a wonderful pool/pool area for an inexpensive price this is it. Staff is very friendly and accommodating, rooms are cleaned very well daily and plenty of fresh towels. Not a bad continental breakfast for free, nothing fancy but does the trick. There is an area go grill out and plenty of room to sit and listen to the ocean. Had no problems with the elevator lobby kept very clean, Great complimentary homemade cookies at the front desk and shampoo and lotion daily too. Will be back and would highly recommende.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels, with a staff of idiots”
Reviews.Author: bdh1875
Reviews.Content: Though Daytona Beach is beautiful, the staff of this hotel is the complete opposite. After my card was charged an incorrect amount, I spoke to a hotel employee who seemed to understand my situation. She told me to speak to the manager the following day, which I did. Unfortunately, this person was completely incompetent and rude, refusing to look at my situation in an objective fashion. She was stubborn and argued with me to the point where I couldn't even look at her without becoming enraged. I have yet to resolve the issue and my account is still overcharged by 70 dollars. I tracked down the number of the company that owns the hotel and plan on calling them later this week.

Reviews.Title: “Rat trap and Dump...This place needs to be demolished and shut down! ASAP”
Reviews.Author: Observer13
Reviews.Content: This the worst place ever! I will never ever ever go back to this dump..............Staff okay,,,Manager does not know crap........Was overcharge to stay in this place for a waste of my time and energy... Only good thing about this rat trap is the location of the beach....I repeat the only good thing is the proximity of the beach........Don't waste your time, money or energy! I warn you stay away...Danger Hazard!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Lillyam
Reviews.Content: Very dirty hotel, bed hard Like a rock, everything is darty elevador, floor, room carpet so darty you can't walk with out shoes. Gross, gross, gross please don't waste your money, if you want a good and fun time don't stay on the islander Resort. Their staff is not professional, they don't care, also they charge $5 per night for a parking. Worst hotel ever..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mysteryman7011
Reviews.Content: AL though the hotel needed repair, the view was amazing the people were nice and it was affordable . I loved it and recommend it for people who aren't sensitive about flaws but are in for a good time and a place to stay that is within a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: loretta3691
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Bikeweek 2011 for 3 nights,what a dump.I could not believe how nasty and in need of repair the rooms were but we had prepaid and stuck in this dump.They have done some repair work but it looks like a 10 year old did it,no a 10 year old would do a better job.The pictures you see on the website are NOT what you get.The carpet felt like walking on a dirt filled wet sponge-IT WAS NASTY!! Do not stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “For God's Sake, Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: diamond2772
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and if we hadn't prepaid for the rooms, would have walked out and gone somewhere else. We had reserved two rooms. They did not have two together but gave us two on the same floor. One room smelled horribly like paint, so much so that it gave you a headache after being in it for five minutes. The other room had a horrible smell that I don't even know how to describe. I guess it was a mix of mildew, dirty carpet, and smoke (although I don't think it was a smoking room). They don't have a computerized key/lock system. They instead have the old fashioned plastic keys with the holes in it which made me nervous to begin with. We got confused with the keys and while trying to figure out which one worked for which room, realized that one of them worked for both. We went down to the desk to tell them and I guess the maintenance man didn't believe us because he gave us attitude as he followed us to the rooms. Turned out ANY key could open that room so back to the front desk. They did give us two new rooms and apologized. The rooms smelled a little better (although still not good) and they skeeved us out, but I pulled the sheets off the bed for inspection and did not find any bugs. The hot tub didn't have any water in it which was disappointing. Although the pool was nice, first my daughter got too close to the water intake, which had very strong suction and a really sharp edge, and it sucked her finger in and cut her hand. Then my son got too close to the intake and it sucked his stomach skin into it which gave him a welt which lasted days. Although I know you get what you pay for, this wasn't even worth the $52 we spent on the room. We would not stay here again even if THEY offered to pay US.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “the balcony was horrible”
Reviews.Author: ellen580398
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with this hotel for 1 night, the price was $ 59 ex tax. The balcony looked like it would come down every minute. The door to the balcony was old and the paint was coming down. They repaired the ceiling above the balcony with concrete and did not clean up the mess. See the photos. For this quality the price of the room should be $ 20.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, Bugs, Bugs”
Reviews.Author: ohboy710
Reviews.Content: While the price and location was just fine, we could not sleep in a hotel with bugs. I found 3 dead "mini roaches' and then 3 living ones in our room. Since we prepaid there was nothing we could do about it, but we left anyways and went somewhere else because I wasn't about to sleep in a room with bugs! The beach and pool were nice though!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: tytulip30
Reviews.Content: We were so disgusted that we couldn't stay! So bad I was willing to loose money not to stay there! Went to a better hotel just right down the road! The elevator smelled of pee, the room smelled of wet dog! When I confronted the front desk, she simply informed housekeeping to go clean - I explained that there was nothing housekeeping could do, the room was clean as good as it could get - their eyes began to roll and sarcasim comments to follow by the staff! I felt like it was a hotel from an intervention show where they rescue a friend from a crack hotel! THAT BAD! Needs to be gutted and start over! They are in an excellent location, right on the beach....but absolutely nasty! Not worth the $40 deal you may get! Wouldn't stay here if it was free! I'm gagging just thinking about it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: BluesTraveler29
Reviews.Content: It is a room & easy access to the beach. It is a old hotel which definatly needs some repairs. First off they have the old key cards with the holes in them...if your not comfortable with that then leave although they do have inroom safes which helped easy my thoughts. The balcony was scary, the concrete was chipping and falling apart and you could see the rebar. I didn't feel safe on it. The bathroom was very small. The beds were old and uncomfortable. The best part about this hotel was the beach access. The pool was ok, the hot tub was not hot and was usually full of teenagers. The Tiki bar was non-existant. Just remember it's only a place to sleep and shower don't expect anything more.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: jigbug
Reviews.Content: Who said this is two star? This should be half a star. The ones giving good reviews must be from to put it nicely a planned community trailer park. A tent may be better. Customers are provided dirty towels from night before. Maids are too lazy to fully stock the bathroom. Kitchen fridge and stove may have been recovered from the ocean but it may work still. The remodeling is from the 1970s. No light in room. The orkin car was out front. Any other hotel should suit your needs better. Tell them to fix it up slightly at least.

Reviews.Title: “Worst then terrible, disgusting and nasty”
Reviews.Author: taylor150
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay and upon arrival called and cancelled 2 of the days as Travelocity would not allow us to cancel all 3. We had booked a smoking room and upon arrival was given a non-smoking room so had to be moved which took 20 min. after waiting 30 to get checked in. The smoking room we were given was absolutely disgusting. There was food left in the refrigerator from the previous guest and no ice trays. The carpet was flithy and door was all rusted and had to be slammed to be closed. If you wanted a shower that was scalding this is the place, even though no one else in the room was using water. The icing on the cake was when we opened the bed to go to sleep there was a hugh blood stain on the sheets. When we approached the front desk and advised them of this we were handed new sheets to put on the bed ourselves, no offer was made to have someone come and replace. We have been fighting with Travelocity and this hotel for a refund for the first night as we left this hell hole and spent the night at another hotel. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU LIKE FLITH.....I WOULDNT SUGGEST THIS PLACE TO MY WORST ENEMY

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: jasonfennell
Reviews.Content: hi i stay at this hotel in mid week got there at 11am i was allow to check in early . that was good of them as they did not have to do that. now room was clean bed was clean all was clean. now if you want a 4* hotel than this hotel is not for you . i pay a very cheap rate for this hotel and was very happy there. now the pool area is clean i watch them clean it 1 morning and they do that each morning. it right on the beach so you can go for a drip in the sea... plus staff was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: miket1976
Reviews.Content: This place should be shut down! The rooms are disgusting and we had mold all over the carpet and mold all over the A/C vents. The ceiling on the balcony looked like the motel had been through a war with huge chunks of concrete missing and holes everywhere. The beds had to be at least 20yrs old and were in terrible condition. The ceiling fan had some nast moldy stuff growing on it. The door going out to the balcony wouldn't close all the way and had a huge gap for "critters" to get in. The refrigerator had rust all over it. The lady at the front counter had a serious attitude problem. Worse hotel we've ever seen! Here are pics.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: 60898Fred
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Islander in Daytona Beach Shores with a family reunion and had such a great time. The staff at the hotel especially Pam and the housekeepers were wonderful to us. We had an oceanfront room and you can never get over the view. Hotel is within our budget and we had a great time. Fred Hutchinson

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: sseay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Islander June 20 through the 25th. The rooms are a good size. We had an 3 rooms all oceafront. The only thing we asked for was extra pillows. They cleaned the rooms daily never had anything taken from any room we had and we had money and laptops left out in plain view. It however is not a resort they do not have a restaurant and the tiki bar is only open on weekends which was upsetting to us. They do have a pool and hot tub and a small childs pool. All located out back of the hotel. Over all it is a decent affordable place to stay with a great location. The reviews with rude staff I dont understand we had o problem with any staff. Rooms 904, 905 and 908.

Reviews.Title: “06-27-10 review::not as bad as reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Bfournier
Reviews.Content: #1. people get carried away with these harsh reviews. My husband and I were planning on going to pcb but due to the oil changed to daytona at the last minute. I went through bookit.com and found the islander for 60 a night oceanfront. Too good to be true? Not exactly. I immediately booked it. I didn't even look at any reviews. After the room was reserved I started to look on tripadvisor and quickly became VERY nervous, but everything went great. Checked in two hours early with no problem (the manager was very nice) also last minute we invited my mother and expected an extra person fee but the lady said it was no problem. The elevators didn't spell like urine or anything nasty as other people stated. I guess they have never been to a beach hotel, they just spelled like beach and chlorine. We were on the fourth floor and it was very clean as well as our room. Was it old and in need of some updates like new carpet? Yes, but it wasn't something overwhelming or gross just old. The view was AMAZING. The pool was clean and so was the spa. We liked that rules like pool hours weren't that strict. Swimming in the pool with the moon light was pretty and romantic. Basically if you come to fl to live in your room you might be dissapointed but if you come for the beach the pool and amazing views at a cheap price it's perfect. One note though the breakfast is bread cereal or oatmeal oj and coffee, so not much to it. And one last thing there is a 100 deposit per person under 26 which can be paid cash or credit. We paid cash and recieved the full 200 back no problems. They didn't STEAL or trick us out of any money. Overall our stay was pretty plesant. If you're expecting the Hilton go pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: psloan4
Reviews.Content: This was the worst vacation we have ever had in the Daytona beach area. The hotel is in major need of updating & needing repair thru out. It looks nothing like the photo's on there web site.It has a very bad order thru out the hotel. Hotel staff are rude & very unfriendly. We had money taken from our room & when I reported it to the staff they were not even surprised that it was missing. The staff refused to call police so I could file a police report. They acted like they could care less OR that they were surprised that this happened. There web site states that this is a resort ....It if far from any type of resort we have ever stayed in. I FEEL THIS IS FALSE ADVERTISING BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT CLOSE TO A RESORT. They also list a pool bar but fail to tell you that it is only open on select hours on the weekends. I would tell anyone thinking about staying here to PLEASE STAY SOME WHERE ELSE. We will never stay here again! There is a 5.00 parking fee that they don't tell you about until you check in.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: JenniferC1976
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel. To start the week off, safe in room did not work, staff knew of this (did nothing) the adjoining room smoke alarm went off on day 2. Maintenance waited until we left for the evening to repair. While we were gone knowing the safe did not work, $900 was stolen from room! After reporting this to management (that did not care) Pat was ever unhelpful. They refused to call the police. Had to call ourselves. Office took report and told us he is out at that hotel at lease once a week his self. After complaining for 5 days and calling corp, we finally got the used condom removed from our balcony. The staff was nothing but rude, and hateful. Be aware if you stay there, you would be better off staying in your car. Only positive is the view of the ocean. When booking you are told the rooms are newly remodeled and that is true maybe 20 years ago. Rooms smell and a bad bad week

Reviews.Title: “Good value for beachside”
Reviews.Author: ATLroadtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days at The Islander, lots of what you read on other reviews are true, it needs to be updated and bedding replaced, but for what we paid in June, with kitchen, facing the beach was a great value. I have stayed at many top hotels, this is not one of them, but you have to know that going in. The pool was very nice, great location with easy beach access. The staff was very friendly and cleaning people were attentive. The Tiki bar was never open, but the lobby and gameroom were nice. Parking was $5 a day and it was a safe clean area with good access to grocery and other stores. If your looking for a decent place on the beach where you are not wanting to spend your vacation in your room, its a good deal, if you want your vacation to be the hotel; your better to spend the 3-4 times the price at a higher end resort.

Reviews.Title: “DONT Stay at this dump!!”
Reviews.Author: kim2010-10
Reviews.Content: the pictures on their website are very outdated! This place was a dump! They were patching all of the balconies because the concrete was falling apart. There was even a balcony that had a huge hole in it. The rooms were disgusting! Refrigerator had rust all over it, bathrooms were filthy, ceiling was falling in near the curtains. The pool was gross, water had a funky smell! Oh yeah and the stairs couldnt be used either. Not sue why, the doors were locked. I overheard a young girl telling the front desk clerk she had a fear of elevators and she could only use the stairs. The clerk told the girl there was nothing she could do because the stairs could not be used. Isnt that a fire hazard? There were kids who just graduated high school in the room next to us. They decided to party until 3am. When I called the front desk the first time he said he would call the room and ask them to keep i down, well I guess the kids got mad because they decided to pound on our walls. When I called the front desk again, he acted like I was bothering him. The cost of this room should have been a lot lower. IT WAS AN ABSOLUTE DUMP!!!!! the only good thing was the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: upakreek
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at this hotel. When we arrived I waiting for 15 minutes to check in.No one was at the desk and when she did show up she took several phone calls before helping me. She was not very nice. The room was dirty. Food from previous guests was left in the refrigerator. Common areas were disgusting, urine in stairwell, breakfast was a joke, and some floors smelled like rotting fish. The beds were uncomfortable. This place is really overpriced for what you get. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY”
Reviews.Author: Dontdoit_10
Reviews.Content: The building is not kept up. Rooms stink,bath tud dirty long black hair in it. When we did fianlly get them to clean it it didnt drain. Air did not keep room cool. The only nice thing about this place was being outside by the ocean!! My daughter let a small wallet there. It took a week before they told me they needed a credit card in order for them to mail it to me. Ispent over 2000 dollars on 4 rooms. Family vacation to make memories but this is what we got beds with torn sheets , to hard to even sleep on,breakfast was old rolls ,bagels, that had been frooze for who knows how long. Happy across the street was a Dennys. Oh back to the wallet it cost me$48.93 to get it mailed back. Should of been $2.50 at the most. Alot of nice hotels down the road from here. I will return to Flordia because I love Flordia but I would sleep in a car,beach,a bench BEFORE I WOULD EVER STAY IN THIS BUGGY STINKY DIRTY PLACE!!!!!!!!! THE RATING I WOULD GIVE IT IS -5. BELIEVE THIS WE ARE NOT KIDDING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “my 16 yr old son asked if we were hurting for money and cutting back”
Reviews.Author: csbump
Reviews.Content: Found it on Orbitz, the place was dirty, not the kind that can be cleaned with soap an water. The gaps at the top and bottom of the door were over an inch wide, there was nothing good about it. It was late so I did sleep there, checked out in the AM and asked for a refund for the two nights that I would not be staying there. NO DEAL, call this number. The number is no good. I booked 2 months in advance, Orbitz would not refund after the first night and neither would the hotel. Pass the mustard so I can eat that $355.00. FREE WIFI-- DIDNT WORK.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel - you will regret it”
Reviews.Author: TARWesternNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayted at this hotel from April 5th through the 8th. The service was absolutely horrible. Check-in time is 3:00 p.m., however the room was not ready until nearly 5:30 p.m. Once I unpacked, I received a call from the front desk saying that they gave me the wrong room. The clerk at the front desk was rude. She had no help and stated that there was no one else there to help, no manager at all. The hotel was run-down and filthy. The shower did not work properly and the refrigerator leaked, the breakfast food was stale and disgusting. The only good thing was the oceanview, the pool was ok, the so-called tiki bar was always closed. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service I would never go back”
Reviews.Author: nicki11988
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there for three days and it happened to be on spring break so the crowd staying there was rowdy young college kids. So because of this they charged us 200 dollars deposit in case we destroyed there room which was fine. It was an ok resort the bar was never open and kids pulled fire alarm three times. The rooms had a good views. The main complaint is that when we were checking out they wouldn't let us leave until someone looked over our room and approved it. They actually made us go back upstairs and wash the dishes and said they would take out deposit money ($200.00) if we did not wash their dishes. I am sorry but if a suite has dishes provided in them then hotel is in charge of cleaning them. They made us feel like criminals for not washing THEIR dishes!! 2 cups and a plate!!! I would never go back the people there are too rude to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, noisy, unkept. Too many dogs.”
Reviews.Author: FredVa
Reviews.Content: Our room with dirty, had not been completely prepared for arrival. Door was proped open. Noisy, barking dogs. Far too many people per room. Incredible wait for service. We checked out first thing the next morning and went to the Palm Plaza, just blocks away. A very fine little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled By the pictures”
Reviews.Author: keke_jo2001
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking online for hotels and had already decided on one and went to book the reservation then saw something about The Islander. So i went and looked at the pictures and what I saw SEEMED to be nicer than where I indended on staying and cost a little more than my other choice. So I booked the room and when I checked into my room I was completely thrown off by what I saw. The Rooms were awful the carpet was worn down by the porch doors therefore nails were poking up. The bathroom doors were coming apart and what was torn off was just painted over. The showers were very old and discusting. When I went to the ice machine located in the hallways the carpets were soaked about halfway down the hall. The room doors in the halls were poorly painted and peeling off. Even the elevators were bad the buttons looked like the had been burned by fire or maybe they had gotten to hot and started to melt.Overall I regret choosing this hotel and wished I would had went with my first choice. So if you are considering this hotel DO NOT be fooled by the pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: samtel5
Reviews.Content: I first want to say,I called the hotel to confirm my reservations,and mr collins and ms pat were great about helping me with my reservations. I told them were there to celebrate my son's 18th birthday. I had some concerns after reading some review's but after my conversation with them on the phone I feel much better. So far thier customer service is great before I arrive and I expect a very good stay. They also upgraded my room with no hassle. I will be looking forward to going there this friday the 10th.and I will write another review when I come back ont the 17th very confident that I will love to come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “For god sake do not go in there, ever!”
Reviews.Author: lost189dollars
Reviews.Content: We made the worst mistake of our lives: Reserved room without reading review for July 4th weekend. Check in time is at 3:00 PM. On July 2nd we were there on time. Money has been taken from our account. We are getting through the front door at the same time young man in his late 20's getting out ; cursing on the phone telling his friend how personnel from this Islander hotel scr#$%^ him up. He was visibly upset. Its our turn. Guess what: the room is not ready. We went outside and waited for an hour and 35 min. Carpet in hotel,elevator and room smell so bad like something just died.We reserved ocean front view and we get Room 417= room with view on empty space between hotels (desert view). We paid for parking space just like we are not guest in hotel,towels have charge as well. 100 years old 19 inch TV didn't work. AC is loud and don't do much except liking just like the one from floor above and all that filthy green water getting down the walls and make horrible smell.We have 2 kids, of course we complained about all this stuff. We had maintenance guy coming to fix TV.It takes him only 2 hour of our time to fix and then he decided to bring the other TV. He was like "sorry for any inconvenience", when I made comment its not the only thing that not works here, he curiously asked me: "Oh, yeah what else is wrong?" Are you serious: indoor swimming pool is filthy room with old dirty sheets all over, tools and who knows what else. Pool outside is gross; dirty.When we asked Manager (short dark hair mean woman & and the other "sweet talking" but same [--] different wrap girl) why the pictures of hotel on Internet look so good and in the real life just about 100% nothing works? Their respond were: "It's like that everywhere you go". Ceiling was hanging and getting ready to lend on our heads any moment. When we went outside to take a look ,we were surprised that this [--] isn't look down for good. Rip off professionals work for this place. We stayed there 1 night and we'd canceled other days. 10 miles down the road much cheaper and million times better service and personnel,room with an ocean view :"Coral Sands hotel" (people let us check in at 11:00 AM : pleasently nice) ... We are Florida residents for 13 years and we have learned something new : NEVER reserve hotel in Florida. Driving by will save you 100's of dollars guaranteed. Many hotels don't have website page but have decent rooms and good rates that could save you a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A Great time in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: littleharvey
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and had a great time. Hotel was great. The service was very friendly and the people that were there was very nice. The room was very clean and great view of the beach. The next time we go to Daytona Beach we would like to stay here again. Thanks,Griffis Family

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair bound and left without room”
Reviews.Author: sherryjhnsn
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation on 6/6/09 for June 12th for 1 night. Made themaware at time of reservation I needed a wheelchair accessible room with 2 beds. Arrived and no wheelchair room available. Told me they could not help me. Charged my credit card days before. Said to go find somewhere else to stay. Left me (Wheelchair Bound) with a 7 year old, no room and already tied up my credit card by charging room in advanced. Will be filing suit in court and contacting BBB.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, pathetic service”
Reviews.Author: fisherpersonflorida
Reviews.Content: Booked online 2 months in advance for ocean front, went to check in at 2 p.m and the old bat at the desk said, "no discussion about the room until 3 p.m.", then at exactly 3 p.m. with 3/4 of the place empty, gave us an ocean-view side room, and charged me an extra 13$ in taxes even though I showed her a receipt for the pre-paid total. She gave us a room with one other group on the the floor--a group of 20 yr old trashy partiers that raised he** until 3 a.m., screaming up and down the halls, etc. I complained about it the next morning, same old bat said I should have called it in, I said you couldn't have missed the noise down here at the front desk or even standing outside the hotel, she said, "sorry--next!" I meant to book the Islander down by New Smyrna but didn't notice the address and didn't realize several places have the same name- it doesn't tolerate nonsense, has a decent staff and is about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard”
Reviews.Author: joesuedoc
Reviews.Content: Booked two days over Memorial Day weekend. Paid for both but only stayed for one. Door to balcony would not open but ocean looked good out the window. The carpet was wet. Our room was 5th floor. King bed mattress is beyond wore-out.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: vdhollin
Reviews.Content: First off, as soon as I walked into the hotel the woman was completely rude to me. I booked the room anyway, because I thought the ocean view was worth it. WRONG! She never told me how much the room would cost before she charged me, I didn't even know she had charged my card until she handed it back with a receipt. Then we get upstairs to find that the pool was out of order (the woman at the desk never mentioned it). The only reason we stayed in that hotel was because we love the pool! It's heated and has a gorgeous view. So I called her to ask if I could get my money back if we left right then, and she said they were still going to charge me! She said we could use the pool at the hotel next door. When we went to find the hotel she was talking about it was about 6 hotels down, and the pool was so cold my 2 year old's lips turned blue as soon as she stepped in it! The room was dirty. The beds were tiny and uncomfortable. The breakfast is terrible. And I had to pay to park in their tiny unlit parking lot! I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, nor will I ever stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All - Front Desk Could Use A Little Improvement On Cust Service”
Reviews.Author: meshel74
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just stayed here for bike week. Although I thought it would be a lot closer to main street where the action was, it was not, but the room was clean and nice, service was not bad, other than one front desk clerk that seemed to be overworked and wanting to get off the phone with me, and literally said she was busy and needed to go, but again, room was nice, pool was nice, and accessibility to beach was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Warning to all....please read this review before booking your stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennck35
Reviews.Content: WARNING TO ALL: If you are thinking of staying in this hotel, please think again and find somewhere else!! This is by far the worst place I have ever stayed in. I am by no means a person that is snooty or has really high standards. I am not wealthy. I just expect that when I stay somewhere that the place be clean. In my honest opinion, Motel 6 is a step up from this place. Here is our experience…. We booked our 2-night-stay at the Islander Resort at Daytona Beach Shores, on their website. It looks like a decent place from the pictures and descriptions. And for the rates it seems like a great deal. Our initial price was $49 per night plus tax. Sounds great right? Let me first tell you what the website does not. A $5 per day parking fee will be automatically added in to your bill. We arrived at the hotel on 6/25/08. The place looks a bit rundown from the outside but I kept my hopes up. The lobby is very well kept. New carpeting and furniture. We also had a nice experience with the front desk clerk. She was very friendly and helpful. Things were looking promising. We got up to the 3rd floor hall and noticed immediately how different things started to look compared to the lobby. The carpet was tattered and dirty, the paint on the walls was peeling, it smelled bad like fish or something, and everything just looked old and worn, in very bad need of an update. When we entered our room is when things got worse. The carpeting was stained and VERY dirty. Don’t even think about walking around barefoot in these rooms. The comforters on the beds were stained and dirty, they looked as though they probably had never been washed. The paint was peeling off some of the walls. There were holes in the corners where the floor meets the wall. The carpeting clearly was not vacuumed or anything in the corners of the room, it was just plain dirty. The bathroom is very, very small. I am not kidding. So small it is just about impossible to close the door while you are in it. You pretty much have to step into the tub in order to close the bathroom door. There was human hair and pubes stuck to the walls in the bathroom. There was quite a bit of mildew in the tub. The bathroom ceiling was splattered with something brown, don’t really want to know what it was. The floor was dirty, it looked as though it might have never been mopped. The only thing that appeared to be clean was the toilet. All these things that we initially noticed were upsetting but we decided could be tolerated seeing that we would not be able to get a refund since we pre-booked our reservations online. We decided to pull back the blankets on the beds and check the sheets. Always check the sheets. Immediately we noticed a couple of small black bugs crawling around on the one bed. They were tiny, about the size of fleas, but not fleas. In the other bed we found a fire ant. There were blood stains on the sheets of one of the beds. Then we checked out the bath towels…some of them had human hair stuck to them. It was at this point that we went back down to the front desk and told her what we found. She immediately apologized and said housekeeping would be addressed in the morning. She gave us 2 new fresh pairs of sheets and pillowcases, as well as all new clean bath towels. So we went back up to our rooms and changed the sheets, left and went to dinner, and came back and went to bed. It was the following day that my son woke up all bitten up on his legs. After inspecting the new clean sheets once more I found more fire ants in his bed. We determined that they must be coming out of the mattresses. It was then that we decided refund or not, there was no way we were going to stay in this place one more night. We packed up our things, went down to the lobby, and told the front desk clerk we were checking out early. She couldn’t have cared less. We ended up losing our money and in addition had to pay to stay at another hotel that night. But I guess it gets to a certain point when you just think there is absolutely no way you can tolerate some things, and $$ is no longer a deciding factor. So I hope you all read this and change your mind about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: supporttravel
Reviews.Content: We live in Orlando and visit Daytona frequently. We booked the hotel the morning of our trip and when we arrived the hotel was nothing like the website offered. The additional charges hit me first, parking $5.00 a day and $1.50 for the safe regardless of use, late check out charge $10.00 per hour, $5.00 for each key not returned. This is ridiculous at a place like this. The breakfast consisted of 5 prepackaged items. I booked my reservation with their reservation desk who said a refrigerator and microwave would be in the room. When I arrived I was told not in a standard room. I did not request a standard room. The website offers very little information about the rooms and no indication regarding the extra fees. The bed sheets had blood stains and hair on them. I was offered a different set to change myself or to change rooms at 10:00pm. The walls in the room were only half painted and mold infested. The carpet, walls and bed pillows all were lumpy. The ocean view rooms overlooked a lot where a building was demolished. Maintenance put caution tape across the hot tub and ½ the pool. When we asked why this was there he explained he was going to paint the deck and didn’t want it to get wet this was on Sunday at 9:00am. (Monday through Thursday during off season may have been a better time for him to do this.)We had already paid for a late checkout so we could stay and swim. We stayed until 1:00 pm and never saw the paint. He was doing nothing but he did chase people away when they swam at that end. Beautiful layout but sadly neglected.

Reviews.Title: “Going back for seconds.”
Reviews.Author: newell94
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year and we are going back this year again. For the price you pay you are not going to get top of the line. We went in not expecting the Hilton so what we got was great. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. Had a great view and there was not a lot of teenagers or college kids making a ton of noise. We got there before we could check in, but they gave us our parking pass and let us use the restroom to change into our suits. Plus when I go on vacation to the beach I don't plan on being in the room but to shower and sleep. I would recomend this hotel to anyone looking for a family get away. Not college kids for partytime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach views”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter84
Reviews.Content: I spent alot of time trying to pick the right hotel for a 4 day stay with 4 friends on the beach in Daytona. Due to last minute reservations alot of places were sold out. I called the 800 number to stay at the Acapulco which was sold out and the Islander was one of the few options that fit our needs. The hotel is somewhat old but the room was decent. We had an ocean front room with kitchen on the second floor. The patio was great and we spent alot of time out there. The only complaint with the room was the small bathroom but we made due. The kitchen came in very handy and made the room more spacious. The outdoor pool was great! Very clean, hardly ever full at all even though we were there with ROTC competitions in town it was still very quiet. The beach is literally a stairway from the pool, nice and clean and very vacant for the 3 days we were there. Never had a chance to drink at the tiki bar by the outside pool as it was only open on the weekend. Didn't take advantage of the breakfast as we slept in every morning and I beleive it was only available until 930 am. Didn't use Wi fi as we were on vacation but I think it was available in the lobby and not the rooms. This location was south of Daytona and a taxi ride was $17 just to Ocean Walk. We did have a rental car as well which came in very handy. The front desk lady was very nice even got us the cab and everything. Pat, I believe to be the manager, was able to let my friend who was in Daytona ahead of me check in under my name as we were stuck for 12 hours at Ohare and didnt get in until 3:30 am. All in all it was a nice place for a group of 24 year olds to have a nice vacation. Even had two children meet up with us and they enjoyed the pool and beach. Very nice vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: waytoodeep
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend a night on the beach for the weekend. Unfortunatelly it turned out to be a nightmare... We arrived at the Islander Resort at 2 pm on Saturday afternoon. The receptionist completed our check-in and told us that our room is not ready yet. Also we were told that we could change at the bathroom in the lobby area and use the pool. We went to the bar near the pool , ordered some drinks and started to wait , thinking that the room should be ready by 3 pm -the check-in time for the hotel. We went to the reception several times until 7pm to ask for our room keys and we got the same answer each time: "your room is not ready yet". We spent the whole afternoon at the parking lot waiting for our room. I was so frustrated and asked the receptionist at least to give us a time , she said she did not know. I asked for the manager, she said she the manager was checking on the housekeeping staff to make the rooms ready and not available to speak with us.She got our cell phone number and said that she will call when the room is ready. There were several other families waiting for their rooms at the parking lot in their cars, since there were no lobby area to sit and wait. Very frustrated, we decided to go our to have dinner. It was 10pm and we still did not receive that call....I called the hotel and was told that the rooms is ready this time. Honestly, I regretted that we waited that long for the room we got finally...It was a disaster.The a/c was very very noisy that I had to turn it off to sleep, the kitchen area was very old and nasty...The sheets were nasty and the pillows were too thin that I could not sleep even putting two of them onto each other. The carpet was dirty, I did not want to walk on it barefoot. There were several bangs and noises coming from other rooms all night long, could not sleep at all. Finally, the breakfast - if that can be called a breakfast-was very very bad...coffee, oj,cereal and skim milk. I did not have a chance to use the swimming pool, but it looked clean unlike the indoor spa. I felt bad for the children who were playing in it... Overall, this was by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed at...Stay away ...

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: crash51
Reviews.Content: While the price per night of this hotel is appealling, it was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. The carpets are stained, the doors are warped, there was food particles on the hotel room floor, which of course means bugs, BIG bugs (specificlly roaches, both dead and alive were found in the room). Plus the sheets were stained. The management ranged from indifferent to hostile. Stay as far away from this place or any of Ocean Waters properties, from the reviews I've now read, they all seem to be in disrepair and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “SO-SO”
Reviews.Author: Alvin241
Reviews.Content: I booked this room before I found this web site and wish I had seen this site first. These are the good things:the a/c was ice cold;the beds were very comfortable; the view was great; the outdoor pool was very nice (very clean); access to the beach was very easy; most of the staff were very friendly(the night guy was a little grumpy); we had a full size refridgerator in the efficency room. The bad things: very little parking(we had to park accross the street the first night); indoor hallway on our floor by elevator was extremely hot;bathroom was very small; indoor pool was gross(stuff floting on top of water[scum] - I wouldn't swim in it if they paid me); they had a coffee maker but no filters; the room was dingy looking(could use some paint); there was a run down hotel that was closed and falling apart next door(walls falling down and you could see int rooms). This place was OK but I wouldn't stay there again. I wouldn't recomend this place unless you get a really great rate(we paid about $400 for 2 nights(the weekend of the NASCAR race). If you do decide to stay here- make sure you get an efficency and stay on an upper floor for the view of the beach and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast!”
Reviews.Author: JANNAJI
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay at The Islander for June 8-10,2007.It was a B-day gift for my niece who was turning 16 yrs. old that weekend.When we arrived at the hotel ,we were greeted by Sherry(front desk clerk).She was very friendly and helpful answering all my questions.Check in was quick .We stood in 4th floor(room 415)..The room was clean and comfortable althougth the bathroom is quite small.It was ok for us though!..The AC ran great and was quiet.The beds were comfy and we got a good night's sleep.There's 2 pools ..one inside(small) and an outside one.There's also a small spa/jacuzzi to the side outside.All 3 were open for use and kept quite clean.The best thing about it is that the pools are just a few steps away from the beach so you have your choice of either one.Breakfast is served from 7am-10am downstairs in the cafeteria and it consists of cereal,bagels,muffins,pastries,fruit,coffee,OJ,or hot chocolate.Not much variety to choose from but it was ok and we kept full for a little while.Dennys is right across the street if you want a hot breakfast like pancakes,eggs,etc.If you're on a budget there's also a Burgerking down the road where you can also get breakfast sandwiches.This location is great if you're looking to relax at the beach.It's a little away from the Pier/Boardwalk about 3 miles.I thought the location was convenient and close to shopping ,restaurants,attractions.This hotel is not the Hilton but it's kept clean.You get what you pay for and lucky for me , I got a great bargain for such a great stay.The elevators and the hallways can use a little more fixing.Maybe a paint job and new carpets but it wasn't that bad.I actually was able to walk around barefoot at this hotel..lol We look forward to visiting The Islander again sometime in the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise after all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: milfordkeds
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sea Garden (aka The Islander) in August 2006 and were very pleasantly suprised. We got a great rate on this hotel and since we were just looking for an inexpensive stay on the beach for a few days before going on a cruise we weren't looking for anything fabulous. I have to say that after reading reviews from various websites I was pretty scared and was prepared to walk out and forfeit the money we prepaid if the place looked as bad as it sounded. It is obvious that the new owners/managment have made efforts to clean the place up. There was new carpet in our room and everything was nice and clean. The pool was kept very clean as well but they had some construction going on around it. They were in the process of replacing concrete and decking in the pool area but kept the work to small sections at a time so that the pool area was still very accessible. The breakfast thing was pretty non-existent so don't count on that. I think they put out a couple of doughnuts and some juice but it was too early in the a.m. for us to bother. The outside bar is very small and wasn't opened at night but it was the off-season (late August) so it was not at all crowded and didn't seem to be an issue for us. Daytona Beach at this time of year was fabulous! We pretty much had the place to ourselves and the beach was totally uncrowded. I would recommend staying at the Sea Garden/Islander. If your expectations are reasonable, you won't find anything better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “injured while arriving !!!!!!! like they care !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: MY mom and dad arrived MAY 8 2006 Looking forward to staying at the seagarden (THE ISLANDER) again this year. BUT .. instead my MOM TRIPPED ON THE MAT at the main entrance to the lobby. She hit her FACE ON THE CEMENT, and severely sprained her hand (SHE COULD NOT USE IT FOR 4 DAYS) she recieved many scrapes and bruises on her arms, legs and face from the fall. The staff at the hotel watched this happen !!!!!!!!!! When she was able to get to the front desk THEY DIDN'T EVEN ASK HER IF SHE WAS OKAY !!!!! when she commented on being hurt to the front desk they did not appear to care. MY MOM WAS VISABLY INJURED AND THE STAFF IGNORED THIS !!!!!! Not a great start to our vacation !!! I would not RECOMMEND this treatment to anyone hoping for a vacation. THE CAREY FAMILY

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here!!!”
Reviews.Author: awsumgator
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here it is a dump!!!!! The hotel has changed names, is now "The Islands", we checked in and not many cars in the lot. Was the first day reopening. The pool was Not open, said our room 234 had been renovated (No WAY!).. But she charged me full price $88.00 a night (she was very plesant). Went in the room, heard banging around from next door and voices, figured the workers were working..... well she said it was a family next door (paper thin walls). So i thought ok. Went out on the balcony to look at the beautiful ocean and enjoy the sight, when i looked down and the balcony had chipped cement making holes everywhere. When taking a shower the water went from normal temp. to scalding hot then finally i was able to screw the knob so the cold water worked. Then would have no hot water. The bed felt like i was sleeping on a childs Plastic mattress cover, hard as a rock it was and i was hot all night long (needless to say i didn't get much sleep). We left first thing the next morning, I told the girl my complaints and she did not even offer to make my stay there right. So we left (a day early i might add).

Reviews.Title: “many fond memories at the sea garten inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife, kids and i have been going to disney for the last 7 years, when choosing a hotel we like it to be waterfront.we chose to stay at the sea garten inn.we liked everything about it,it was on the beach,the pool was the best in daytona beach,and the staff were always nice to us.directly across the street is red lobster, dennys,and one of the best italian restaurants i have ever eaten in called the portofino. we ended up buying a vacation home in new smyrna beach which is nearby.that is how much we loved the area.even though we have a home in the area now,we will once in a while spend a night or two at the sea garten in just for the good memories we have at that hotel.i recommend staying there. the rooms are nice the ocean view is spectacular,and the staff is polite.what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “what a piece of sh#$ the room was discusting and pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room was so discusting and pool was full of dirt .. there were 8 of use split into 2 of the same type of room and we were charged 2 different prices..The worst part of my experience was the manager .. we were all kicked out after being there for 2 hours because the manager didnt want any one out side of the room ..this is great for someone who wants to stay in an outdated retirement home..and be humiliated by an control freak..

Reviews.Title: “past its sellby date”
Reviews.Author: jeanCardiff_Uk
Reviews.Content: Very smelly room, no way refurbished. Shame to waste a holiday stay here, not comfortable. Agree with previous reviews where safety has been questioned especially the out of date elevator certificate - why is this allowed to continue trading? Great location but this did not make up for the state of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for, cheap but clean room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and housekeeping was nice and helpful. Has the potential of being a really nice motel. The pool area could be be really nice however they never cleaned it while we were there. The snack bar was never opened. The exercise room is a tiny room on the 6th floor with a few pieces of equipment and no air condition. The ice machine on the 3rd floor did not work. The kitchen area was very very small and out dated appliances. Half of the lights in our room did not work because the plug ins didn't work. The indoor pool area is not a pool to swim it is a big hot tub which would have been fine except it had about 6 inches of foam that floated on the top. All in all I guess it was one of those things where you get exactly what you pay for, the room rate was cheap and so was the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpville”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never been more dissatisfied. There was no microwave or mini fridge in our room. There was a large water stain on our ceiling. No light bulb in the ceiling fan. Most channels on the tv were snow. I could not get ice from any ice machine. Not sure I would have wanted it. The ice machines had a very bad odor. All of the people in our group were charged different rates...I can only assume on the whim of whoever was checking them in. Even those with micros and fridges and efficiencies paid less than we did. Front desk staff rude and not at all helpful. It seemed as though I was an interruption instead of a guest. The web site states pool bar..yes they have one...but it was never open. The indoor pool was only a hot tub. I will send an identical email to the Chamber of Commerce, BBB, and to any magazine in which they advertise. Any website where I can post a review I will do so. Fair warning to anyone considering going to this property...DON'T.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sea garden 7/17/05 thru 7/24/05. The room and motel were generally run down. There were holes in the walls and torn carpets but generally everthing worked. We had to ask daily for towels and personal items. The pool had mold growing around it and the kiddie pool had sand in it all week. They do not have the bar open by the pool as advertised and the BBQ. grill was broken as well as the weight equipment in the exercise room. The biggest problem was not enough parking at the motel. The manager ask that you park in a back lot behind the Denny's Restraunt across the street and assures you nothing will happen to your vehicle but would not agree to cover any damages. All this for just $ 100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “What an unorganized Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at Sea Garden Inn, I thought it to be better that I had expected from all the other comments that had been made. After about 30 minutes of being there, I soon found out that the comments being made about the hotel were all true. I had rented 2 rooms, 1 for my family and 1 for a friend. We checked in and went to my friends rooom first and the bed was pulled away from the wall and setting out in the middle of the room. We immediatly called to the front desk and maintenance came right away. I did receive an apology and it was the only apology that we received. Then my room was open and would not lock. After maintenance worked on it for 30 minutes and all the next day it still was not fixed and when we left, it still was not fixed. If you want your room to lock do not stay in 602. When we left the key was still hanging up in the door and would not come out. To top all of this off, we had no water for the biggest part of the day Saturday. The front desk said that 2 main lines had busted and maintenace was working on it. When the water did work, I was in the shower, my husband had went down to the lobby and my little girl was in the room watching TV. All of a sudden, some people was coming in our room and it scared her so bad that she was crying. The front desk had booked our room to another couple. Not knowing that we were in the room, they had a key and come right on in. It scared them has much as it did my little girl and myself. They too could not get their key out of the lock and had to call housekeeping and she called down to the front desk. All of this was going on while I was tring to get out of the shower. We did get a free night out of the hotel but from all of the problems we should had gotten all 4 nights free. What we did not get was an apology. There was one manager there that just did not give a HOOT. There were other guest complaining and he told them that if they did not like it they could leave. I will never stay at this hotel again. TOO many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned home from the Seagarden Inn. I chose this hotel based solely on it's positive reviews. There were very few negative reviews and even the negatives weren't anything I thought I couldn't tolerate. My 3 children (2 of which hadn't ever been to the beach)were anticipating a very memorable vacation. It was memorable to say the least! As I always do when I first enter a hotel room, I did a quick walk-thru to check everything out. The first thing I noticed was a half-eaten gallon of ice cream and half-drank gallon of milk left in the refrigerator by the previous guests. Housekeeping?!?! The balcony door wouldn't open. It required a "running start" to open every time. The air-conditioning unit sounded like it had an internal waterfall. The towels were so cheap and thin I could see through them. The water pressure needed a pressure adjustment and the water tempature had a mind of it's own. On the 3rd day (Friday) the water went completely out throughout the hotel. The front desk told me the problem was from the 5th floor down but I was on the 7th floor?!?! They told me they hoped to have the problem corrected that night. When I left on the 5th day (Sunday) the water had been partially restored to about a 30% trickle. Management admitted the problem was a "bad valve" and couldn't be corrected until Monday. I was refunded $25.00. Very little compensation for the inconvienience of no water for more than 24 hours, bearing in mind I have 3 children. The pool deck was very dangerous. There were several areas of standing water and the tiles around the pool ledge were broken and jagged. My husband slipped and cut his foot on one of the damaged tiles. He went directly to the front desk with a towel around his bleeding foot to report the 1 1/2 inch laceration. The front desk clerk thanked him for letting them know??? I guess that explained the sign at the pool stating use was at your own risk. I will not stay at the Seagarden Inn again and I don't recommend it to anyone who intends to stay clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bikeinthecorn
Reviews.Content: Indoor pool is more of a "science experiment" then a pool. It is a overly large whirlpool that I never saw cleaned. Outdoor pool is large , but again during 2 weeks I never saw it cleaned, (ie vacumed). Staff was not too friendly. Seem to be resigned to working in a dump. Water was turned off for approx. 6-7 hrs on 1 day with no prior notice. Staff only offered excuses, such as "The building is old, We ran into unexpected problems, etc" I didn't pay $87/day for excuses. We have stayed there in May and again a few yrs b4. The Seagarden,(along with the rest of Daytona) is regretably going downhill. If your a beer-swilling,NASCAR fan trying to get a break from the trailor park you'll love it here. If your looking for peace, and serenity forget it

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sea Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. For the price that we paid for an ocean view, we weren't expecting a five star hotel. We were very happy with our room and the facilities. The staff could not have been any better. Our room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were left. The hotel is very family friendly. The beach was beautiful and not crowded outside of the hotel. We would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “yuck horrible nasty rude unsafe over priced”
Reviews.Author: ynotdoubt
Reviews.Content: Wow..Staff rude from check in to check out. Room unsafe and dirty, balcony railing loose, no smoke alarm.. just wires sticking out of the wall. Hotel room phone did not work. Bath Towels smelled like old wet socks. Bathroom shower had 2 H labels faucets..I found out after I got scalded. The worst part of the experience was the manager and staff..Their attitude..They could not care less if one's room is in working order or not. No offer of apology or monetary refund. Place is overpriced for what one can truly get for 100 bucks a night. We were here on a family reunion. They lost another family members reservation..once again no apology no cares, in fact they threatened to have her arrested when she complained..We were told by management "Not our problem..it's your problem" even though they had written confirmation. The unprofessionalism exhibited by the staff was an all time high witnessed by me.

Reviews.Title: “A waste of a beautiful location and view.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great oceanfront view, large pool, and even an indoor pool, but still a dump. The hotel and the pools were filthy. There was no pool maintenance during my stay and inconsiderate guests used the pool deck and beach as an ashtray. With no maintenance, it got pretty ugly quick. Staff did not wear uniforms and were practically invisible. I did not observe any hotel security. If you enjoy drinking, smoking and basking in your own litter, this is the place for you. If not, or if you are vacationing with your children, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “the best place ever is sea garden inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You just have to go to Sea Garden Inn.It is the best place ever.Although I've saw bad reports on other hotels this should never have a bad report.It was cheap for ocean front,full kitchen and one room with four people in it four five nights at the cheap price of $456.32.This is one place you should consider going to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting on the Atlantic ocean”
Reviews.Author: laniejo
Reviews.Content: The Sea Garden Inn sits right on the beautiful Atlantic ocean in Daytona Beach Florida. The lobby was clean and comfortable, and furnished with white wicker furniture. Our room was on the ninth floor, and had a partial ocean view. The room was ok, but could use some new paint and updated decor, as well as the hallway. The outdoor swimming pool sits on the ocean side of the building, and is big and warm and wonderful. There is also an outdoor hot tub, and a large indoor hot tub too. The beach is pristine and beautiful, with the warm Atlantic ocean to swim and play in. We enjoyed our stay at the Sea Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Rather sleep in the car!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here out of necessity. We had been at Magic Kingdom and stopped to visit family in Daytona and needed a place to stay for the night before heading home. We checked several places and found only this hotel with two rooms available, so we took what we could get. I would have rather slept in my car after this experience. It was filthy. I was afraid to touch anything in the room and if it wasn't for my exhausted children, I would have just checked out and driven through the night to get home. There was something foamy and unrecognizable in the indoor pool and I wouldn't even go into that room to get a closer look. The hotel room was dirty as well, from top to bottom. There was mold, mildew and other undesirable odors. We had to unplug the refrigerator because it was so noisy. It had a good view, which is the ONLY positive thing I can say about it. No matter how cheap ($99/night), it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (2Ad,2ch) stayed in Seagarden Inn during spring break from March 20-23. We got a really cheap rate of $55 a night during spring break which was really good, and expected for the place to be a dump. After reading reviews, I was suprised that it was not bad. We had an oceanfront efficiency on the 3rd floor. My only problem was the bathroom could have been a little cleaner and housekeeping needed to vacuum the room better, other than that the pool was decent and location was good since we were away from most of the college crowd. For the price I would definitely stay there again if I was looking for something cheap. We usually stay at Oceanwalk but prices were to high for the time period, so I went already being disappointed about where we were staying, but like previously said for the price it was not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst we stayed in during our recent stay in Florida. The place was shabby, the indoor pool couldn't have been less inviting and the room was dingy. The only thing going for it is it's location on the beach. Unfortunatly you are not sleeping on the beach! Avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean+ friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great beach access; good pools; basics only: no shampoo, only donuts

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel since it was the sheraton had been there 5 years ago and was still very nice but this time was terrible rooms were not clean need vaccuming badly especially in corners halls were dirty elevators dirty plus they made terrible noises wondering if they were safe and one did quit working for 2 days rooms smelled we had to buy air fresher and burn candle non smoking rooms but cigarette butts on our balconey. fan in bathroom made a loud noise had to keep that door shut since only 1 light control for 2 rooms some sort of little ants in kitchen little blood specks on pillow case and bed spread guess they would not come out in the wash (hope they had been washed) front of phone broken

Reviews.Title: “falling tub”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: not a clean hotel at all nothing working we stayed in room 711 tub falling sink stopped up and tolet would not flush. Dont look at the photos on e net not correct no bar no kids program no resturant nothing to offer at all conti breakfast was ok but no milk for kids they get coffee also, will not stay here again. We stayed from 7/14-7/17 never again We did suggest another room they said there was none but still checked people in.

HotelInfo.Name: The Islander Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3161 South Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
